relating to the people of Finland or a group of languages including Finnish, Estonian, and Sami: In Finnic languages, pronouns come at the end. The various Finnic tribes, believed to have settled in this region more than 2000 years ago, were nomadic and roamed over large distances.
More examplesFewer examplesIn Finland, the Sami are usually considered as separate from other Finnic peoples, but in Norway they are sometimes called Finns because of their Finnic language.Some Finnic languages in the area near the Arctic Circle are under threat of extinction.There are common features in the Finnic mythology found in Finland and Estonia.
